items.title: Revert to previous redirect behavior with 303 See Other
properly parse port from host header when applicable
file performance
items.body: Increases large body response performance by an unspeakable amount.

items.title: fix http client sending body twice
items.body:
- The request serializer was not updated appropriately to match the response serializer's changes in https://github.com/vapor/engine/pull/137
- Fixes https://github.com/vapor/engine/issues/139

items.title: fix http restrictions
items.body:
This pull request removes some restrictions on HTTP requests and clients that prevent Vapor 1.x from being compatible with proxies. 

**Remove the restriction against absolute URIs in request paths**
As mentioned in RFC2616 (§ [5.1.2](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-5.1.2)), start lines _can_ contain absolute URIs. @LoganWright could you clarify why this code was added? The comment makes it seem like this was an important change: `Absolute URIs are deprecated and MUST NOT be generated`.

**Remove the restriction against requests having different scheme, host, or port**
It seems proxies were simply not considered here. However, we should verify this doesn't have a negative affect on any existing code.

items.title: allow email init w/ array of to
items.body: fixes an issue preventing creation of an email to multiple people using an array.

items.title: Make Foundation.Data ResponseRepresentable
items.body: This extension allows `Bytes` data like `mysql blob` to be `ResponseRepresentable`, so that stored data like images or audio files can be served as binary file.
